definition: female general/(fig.) woman who is a leading figure in her area of expertise
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: It's what the Chinese women distance runners use to improve their endurance.
sentences.chinese: 中国的长跑女将都是用这个来增强耐力的。

sentences.english: However, who can know, this female general is child bride one's previous experience however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，谁能知道，这位女将军却是童养媳出身。

sentences.english: All three of the Owen women were on the plane bound for Brussels. (para. 3)
sentences.chinese: 欧文家的三员女将都在去布鲁塞尔的航班上。

sentences.english: Daniel, do you know who's the first woman general in Chinese history?
sentences.chinese: 大牛，你知道中国历史上第一位女将军是谁吗？

sentences.english: The first female general Li Zhen died.
sentences.chinese: 新中国第一位女将军李贞逝世。

sentences.english: Who in the first recorded female general in Chinese history?
sentences.chinese: 在中国历史上有文字记载的第一位女将军是谁？

sentences.english: All three of the Owen women were on the plane bound for Brussels.
sentences.chinese: 欧文家的三员女将都在飞往布鲁塞尔的航班上。

definition: fierce general/valiant military leader/fig. brave individual
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
Mu Guiying, female warrior and heroine of the Yang Saga 楊家將|杨家将
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
(politics) strongman/(in the workplace, esp. of a woman) a highly capable person/(old) robber
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
to fight with all one's might
